content.description: Steep off the deck, to seam/crack with balancey moves out to a techy gently overhanging face. Stays on you! Finishes up and left in blue stone.
content.protection: 10 QDs, shared fixed biners with Drunken BBQ.
content.location: 3rd bolt line from the left of the wall. Drunken BBQ is about 8 feet left and Old Chub is about 5 feet to right.

content.description: One of my favorite lines here! It starts out with a steep v4ish boulder problem which is the crux. Then Goes up to a 5.9 slab then up to a perfect lieback crack which is sustained 11 climbing for about 50 feet. Just an awesome line!!
content.location: Far left on the upper hops garden wall.

content.description:
This is the second route from the left on the Lower Hop Garden Wall. A large cleft and step in the hillside marks the break between Upper and Lower Hop Garden Walls.

This route takes the slab for a few bolts to a steep boulder problem followed by more technical climbing before easing to the anchors.

I thought this climb had perfectly sculpted, varied holds and great movement. The business is fairly condensed, though.
content.location: Right of Grasshopper (10a) that is the farthest left route on the Lower Hop Garden Wall. Sits directly above a nice little belay stance/ledge.

content.description: Sustained pocket climbing at the start, then eases off before a delicate, balancy finish. Heads to the right at the top and shares anchors with Hopsickle.
content.location: Starts just to the left of Hopsickle.

climbs.name: Hopulence
climbs.fa: Equipped: Bill Ohran, F.A. Dewi Butler

content.description: Consistent climbing. Lot's of small holds and a bit sharp. Fun movement as it eases up half way.
content.location: Starts left of big hand ledge.

content.description: Great Route with a fun stiff crux on blue stone about midway.
content.protection: 9 Bolts to Chains ( currently chains have biners, 4/6/16)
content.location: Middle of the Upper Hops Wall, In Between Old Chub and Hop Henge. Shares Chains with Old Chub. Would appear to be the 4th Route from the left ( Counting the shared start of Molson Golden and Drunken BBQ as Rout #1)

content.description:
Crimp, pocket, scoop, runnel, chert.  You'll find a little of everything on this route.  Begin with a low first bolt on blue face, down and right of the Hop Rising arete.  The line goes straight up to a midway point, then curves sharply right at a scoop with a rail.  Scratch your head and ponder that abrupt change in the bolt line, or just Hop on and see what happens when you hit it!

Note that there's a Hop Stoopid in the Limestone Bible and a Hop Stupid in the Goss guide with conflicting details.  I believe the description and info entered here are accurate, but your corrections are welcome.  The grade given is 11b, but it could be debated as closer to 11a.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchor with mussy hooks
content.location: The meeting point of Lower and Upper Hop Garden forms a small alcove. Hop Stoopid starts on the left side. This is the first climb on Upper Hop Garden, and it's just down and right of the Hop Rising arete.

content.description: Awesome arete! very fun climb. mostly vertical with good footing and decent holds. i think the crux is a couple bolts from the chains.
content.location: The arete on the right. after the slabby  looking climbs.

content.description: Starts on some vertical finger slots goes up to edges and sidepulls up under an overhang. take a good rest and get ready for the crux. pull over the bulge and then some balancy reachy moves and up to the chains which are slightly higher than those for Hop Rising. personally i like this one more than Hop Rising but they both are about as good of lines for their grade as you can get.
content.location: just to the left of Hop Rising.

content.description: Starts out with some easy moves to get you on the wall then goes through some low 5.11 climbing to an overhanging crux which is kinda hard to read. Once you pull the over hang you go through some more hard 11 moves up a vertical face to the chains. the topo that i have says that this is 12a. but it felt a little easier to me so feel free to put a rating on it.
a nice easy one. traverses slightly right as you climb up. goes underneath a couple small roofs i think but think it climbs around them rather than through them.
content.location: to the left of the 12c. is the left most route on the lower hops garden.

content.description: Shares the boulder start with Molsen Golden. This route breaks right from the corner onto the thin face. This line has big moves on a variety of hold sizes. Good climbing.
content.location: A couple left of Hopsicle and right of Molsen Golden.
